title: (x) Constructivist Lettering - hand drawn {gang}
content:
Hi all,   
   
I want to know what font is in the picture 'LENIN'. It seems Russian, but could I make it in English fonts? or anyone know what this russian font is. Thank you for all help!   
   
 [Lenin.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130607102641/http:/www.linearossage.it/Book%20Lenin.JPG)   
   
-------   
TyPO   
\*\*\*\*\*   
-------
author: typo

comments.content: One place to start is P22 fonts

Another possible source of information may be [Paratype](http://web.archive.org/web/20130607102641/http:/www.paratype.com/) who advertise themselves as a multilingual foundry specializing in Cyrillic.   
   
cheers,   
Dana

hello. i belive its custom lettering.. based on Futura..   
   
t80

\*Thank you all for helping!   
   
I just wanted to do something about the Communist theme, now I think it is so hard to find out what font was used in that picture. However, I have found another good font that would be good for me. Here you go   
 ![C:\worker.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130607102641im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/48173.jpg)   
And, you would download this free font here if you like it too!   
 [font URL](http://web.archive.org/web/20130607102641/http:/www.nicholascarvan.com/fonts.htm)   
   
\*Again, thank you so much, I love this forum!   
   
-------   
TyPO   
\*\*\*\*\*   
-------
It's as beautiful as it is quirky... and yeah, it's probably hand drawn.

Nice find, TyPO. Other constructivist fonts: **[1](http://web.archive.org/web/20130607102641/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/3090.html) / [2](http://web.archive.org/web/20130607102641/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/4100/19687.html) / [3](http://web.archive.org/web/20130607102641/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/8220.html) / [4](http://web.archive.org/web/20130607102641/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/41964.html)**
